title: Underwhelming
text: Not the most organised place of interest for tourists to visit as individuals not on a tour. Cable car ride to top was good with no long queues as we arrived first thing in the morning. Not enough information on how to deal with the local monkeys jumping on your back without warning! This unfortunately happened to me within minutes of exiting the cable car which certainly put a damper on my visit as I spent the rest of my visit terrified another monkey would do the same. A nearby staff member removed the monkey and instructed people to wear their backpacks on their front. Information giving you directions around the sight and the various walking trails down from the summit was minimal and areas of interest underwhelming. The weather however was favourable and allowed great views in all directions. Sorry to say it’s a place I can say I’ve been to and don’t need to return.

title: Incredible
text: Well worth the walk up the hill, amazing views of Athens in all directions. Make sure you have hat, sunscreen and water in the warmer months as the heat can be quite intense. Incredible architectural remains to be amazed by.

title: Beautiful Museum
text: Beautiful museum, well thought out in design with it being very easy to wander through. Amazing history details with the below ground exhibit allowing incredible insight into life in ancient times. A visit here combined with the Acropolis made for an incredible day.

title: Amazing
text: Such a beautiful walk to view the Acropolis. Sign posts are few and far between-google maps helpful. Admission tickets inexpensive and wait time was short first thing in the morning. So much to see on top of hill and surrounding areas, definitely worth a visit.

title: Anniversary weekend
text: Lovely weekend at the Fantauzzo hotel. Great location surrounded by restaurants/bars and beautiful views of the Brisbane river in both directions. Special touches were given by hotel- wine/dessert delivered to room complimentary with a lovely note attached and an upgrade to the highest floor. Would definitely return.

title: Good budget airline
text: Good budget airline, similar to domestic airline flights in Australia. On time, friendly air steward staff, no frills airline.

title: Great Hotel
text: Such a great place to stay, would definitely return when visiting Singapore again. Staff were very welcoming and always helpful. Rooms have everything you need with bottled water replenished daily. Loved enjoying the included breakfast each morning down in the alfresco area surrounded by gorgeous gardens. Perfect location for sightseeing, being able to walk to many locations. Rooftop area with pool was a relaxing area to cool down each afternoon and look out over the city.
place: Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay (SG Clean)

title: Easy travelling
text: Travelling on the MRT for the first time on a recent visit was very straightforward and convenient from purchasing your ticket to arriving at your destination. Both the stations and trains were spotlessly clean with trains arriving frequently.

title: Breakfast with the Orangutans
text: Enjoyed a close up visit the orangutans and breakfast was good. Fairly compact zoo with lovely scenery and vegetation. Elephant show good to watch with shuttle bus around zoo very handy.

title: Magical Visit
text: A magical place to visit and wonder through. Lovely cool change from the weather outside and the range of beautiful plants is amazing. View from the top level and walk along elevated paths may be a little daunting for those wary of heights! Would definitely visit again.

title: Great local Indian food
text: Food was excellent, great service. Smaller local restaurant, very busy on the takeaway side. Dishes generous and served with minimal wait time. Will definitely return.

title: Amazing food!
text: Very lively, busy restaurant. A little too loud at times-we were there for an anniversary dinner for two! Service was great, staff were efficient and friendly. Food was incredible-fresh and very tasty. Generous serves at reasonable prices. Would definitely return.

title: Five Stars
text: Just like any 5 star hotel in Brisbane without the exorbitant price. Apartments are modern, spacious and beautifully clean with the most comfortable beds. Staff are very welcoming and helpful. My favourite place to stay in Brisbane.

title: Fresh and vibrant
text: First time staying at this hotel and pleasantly surprised. Hotel is quite vibrant and trendy in appearance, rooms very clean, comfortable and have loads of features. Position in the city is perfect- close to main shopping mall, the gardens and river. Would definitely stay here again.

title: New Years Eve Fireworks
text: Watched the fireworks down by the Brisbane river at Eagle Street Pier. Beautiful position, easy to see the fireworks and not too crowded. Even though late at night with lots of party goers, it felt very safe. Lovely way to bring in the New Year.

title: New Years Eve dinner
text: My husband and I loved this restaurant. Had the Christmas Feast menu and the food on the most part was great. Anti pasta to begin with was a little average but main and dessert were excellent. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. Atmosphere in restaurant was very lively- great soundtrack playing. Overall, a great night.

title: Must-do bus tour!
text: Informative, fun-filled bus tour of the city with our driver Dennis who joked and sang the whole way. A must-do tour to see Dublins more well known sights as well as learn interesting local facts.

title: Fantastic food!
text:
Incredible food, great location and atmosphere! A restaurant you must go to in Rome.
The best tiramisu I've ever eaten.

title: Great value meals
text: Great value lunch deals, the spinach and ricotta cannelloni was delicious. Service was fast and friendly. Would definitely return.

title: Half-day cooking class
text: Fantastic time in the kitchen, the two chef instructors were very informative and the food we made was the best I've tasted in Italy- if I say so myself!
